title: Foundation: Bachelor's Degree in Education or a Subject Area
description: A strong academic background is crucial. A Bachelor of Education (B.Ed) is ideal. Alternatively, a BA or BSc in a specific subject (like English, Maths, or Science) combined with teaching experience is also a great start.

title: Gain Teaching or Counseling Experience
description: Credibility as a consultant comes from practical experience. Work as a teacher in a school or as a career/student counselor for several years. This provides invaluable insight into the education system, student challenges, and curriculum.

title: Master's Degree and Specialization
description: Pursue a Master's degree to deepen your expertise. You can specialize in areas like Educational Psychology, Curriculum Development, Educational Leadership, or Special Needs Education. This elevates your profile from a teacher to an expert.
salaryRangeLKR: LKR 100,000 - 180,000 (as a senior teacher or academic coordinator)

title: Transition to Consulting Role
description: Begin your consulting career. You might join an established educational consultancy firm, work for an NGO in the education sector, or start your own practice. Focus on a niche, such as study-abroad counseling, teacher training, or school improvement.

title: Senior Education Consultant / Policy Advisor
description: Become a recognized expert in your field. As a senior consultant, you'll work on large-scale projects, advise educational institutions on strategy, or contribute to national education policy development. A PhD can open doors to high-level advisory and research roles.
institutes: N/A - Based on reputation and experience
